main event: A round, white object was observed hovering and then leaving rapidly in a westbound direction on the night of February 5, 1958.
interesting points: The sighting was reported under clear skies with good visibility., The object was noted to hover at a low altitude (estimated 1000-1500 ft)., There were conflicting descriptions regarding the shape and size of the object., The observer believed there was a smaller object trailing behind the main object., A witness reported seeing a 'sheet of fire' and a rock the size of a man's head was recovered at the site.
witness description: Sgt. Handy of the State Police and Mr. Brown of Keeseville, New York
